answers.answer: Hello,Frequent urination in adults can be due to many causes. The primary cause which needs to be excluded is diabetes. Diabetes not only causes frequent urination but also numbness and tingling sensations. I would advise you to get a fasting blood sugar and Hb A1 C test done.If diabetes is ruled out then other possibilities which need to be ruled out are prostatitis (inflammation of the prostate gland), interstitial cystitis, overactive bladder syndrome, stroke and other neurological diseases, urinary incontinence, bladder cancer(rare) and bladder dysfunction .Please consult a urologist in that case.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: I am a healthy 35 year old male.Please help..what can this be?  I went to the doctor and they told me it may be Prostatitis.  They gave me some antibiotics Doxycycline which has done nothing to relieve my symptoms.  I am urinating every hour...and I feel like I have to urinate a gallons worth and all that comes out is a weak stream and it is not a lot of urine either. I am having trouble at night sleeping too as I feel pressure on my prostate and just an urge to pee all the time.   No pus, no blood, nothing out of the ordinary other then an urge to pee, a weak stream, and pressure on my prostate.  I have had these symptoms for over a week.Help....!
title: I AM HAVING TO URINATE VERY OFTEN AND AM FEELING SLIGHT PRESSURE ON MY PROSTATE
